snippet: 8:45 p.m. | Updated Federal authorities on Thursday arrested three employees of some of the world's largest technology companies on charges that they leaked confidential corporate information. The charges are the latest brought by the government i...
abstract: Federal authorities arrest Walter Shimoon of Flextronics, Mark Longoria of Advanced Micro Devices, Manosha Karunatilaka of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company and James Fleishman of Primary Global Research on charges they leaked confidential corporate information to hedge funds and others; Daniel DeVore of Dell, enters guilty plea and is cooperating with authorities; arrests are part of sprawling insider trading case built around prosecution of Raj Rajaratnam; photo (M)

byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and PETER LATTMAN; William K. Raushbaum and Evelyn M. Rusli contributed reporting
